Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial on the Risks of Peribulbar Anaesthesia

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria excluded patients with known orbital or ocular diseases. The study setting was a hospital radiology department.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the proximity of the medial canthus to the optic nerve and the safe angle between the orbit and globe using CT imaging.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the distance from the medial canthus to the optic nerve, assessed using multiplanar reconstructed CT images.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This single-centre retrospective study involved 200 patients over 60 years old who underwent CT head studies for non-orbital indications between September and October 2020.

Result_Outcome.evidence: In 1.5% of the sample, the optic nerve was within 20 mm of the medial canthus, with a minimum distance of 15 mm.
